placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
roomTip: Be patient and the pool will free up. It's only small but people don't spend all day there.
text:
The view is the absolute best thing about this hotel. The view and the food. And excellent service.
The view, the food and the excellent service... and the rooftop bar.
And the infinity pool.
OK so this hotel has a lot going for it.

We'd booked in advance and paid a little extra for a (what we interpreted as) better room. We were a little disappointed to discover our family room was on the sub-level. Once we spoke to the reception they understood and installed us into a top floor room with amazing views over Kandy.
The food is great here. Chef will come out and say hello during dinner service. Breakfast is also excellent and swift.
Make sure you get a chance to enjoy the pool. Being on the edge of the world and looking into the busy green city is not to be missed. The pool is small and cute and only a few loungers so you need to be friendly with your fellow guests.
Also make sure to enjoy the evening sunset views from the rooftop bar. The music is good, the barmen are good, the vibe is good. It's just a good time!

Highly recommend this hotel for families and saw many couples enjoying it too.

Make sure you tip the bellboy. He's a good dude.

The rooms have international plugs, AC, minibar, hairdryers etc... the bathrooms have toiletries and everything you need.
Definitely get a tuktuk or taxi as its up a big hill.
title: Luxury with an amazing view

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text:
This hotel is a must stay if you are planning on overnighting in Kandy. 
One can oversee the entire valley from here.
Especially the traditional curries served for breakfast are really good and the service of all staff was extraordinary and extremely friendly.
I can definitely recommend this place!
title: Breath taking location with incredible service!!!

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
roomTip: Don’t get a room too close the elevator
text:
The hotel is in a great location and staff goes out of their way. There is a nice little pool and two restaurants (which have the same menu, although they claim differently).
But many of the smaller things could have been done better. The windows have blackout curtains, but you can’t properly close them. There is no suitcase rack in the room. The doors plays a noisy tune when opened, which has no added value and only disturbs the guests in the other rooms. And finally, the rooms are absolutely not sound proof. You can clearly hear noises from all your neighbors and the hallway. And somehow people are pushing furniture around all day starting at 6 AM and ending around 11 PM.
Nice design, nice location, but a bit too restless for us.
title: Nice but no soundproofing

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text: What a beautiful, tranquil hotel set high in the hills. The service was great and the food/drink and views amazing. The infinity pool over Kandy is just the icing on the cake. Easy to access Kandy city by either tuk tuk or taxi. Highly recommend staying here if you visit Kandy!
title: Modern hotel with great views of Kandy

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text:
beautifully located on a hill a bit outside of the city center. Wonderful restaurant terrace with a view over Kandy and a rooftop terrace with drinks (they did however not have our first choice of drinks from the bar menu available).

Very friendly staff.

Besutiful rooms, ours with a balcony with a view over Kandy.

Small infinity pool on the restaurant level with the same view.

very good food from the buffet, both for dinner and for breakfast.

The only negative point: no five stars because of the way too loud and bad live music during dinner (in our case a guitarist playing songs like ‚Country Roads‘ etc. but off key and way too loud), played without a break (!) from 7 to 10 pm. No conversation possible, even after we had asked to tune the volume down.
title: nice hotel - if it was not for the loud music…

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text: Easy access from the city to this hidden gem and you have  the best views of around kandy from your room's balcony and almost everywhere within the hotel's premises. spacious rooms with all the amenities, Infinity pool is one the best I've ever seen and don't forget to try the both roof top bar and the downstairs restaurant which also comes with a various collection of drinks for you to enjoy. Had the best evening at the roof top bar while having a freshly brewed beer along side with chef's exquisite creation of delicious cuisine which served by a young crew who always wear a smile. Thank you grand serendib .
title: Best View of the City, They'll assure an elegant experience

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text: The staff was very friendly and the room was well otganized and comfy. We did not eat at the hotel but the food smells good! Also very good laundry servicd, quiet location not very far from the lake. Be smart and use the staff to get tultuk and reccomendations
title: Lovely stay

text:
I am amazed of this beautiful hotel, which offers value for money. Very friendly and supportive staff members. From the first call for direct booking until my check out, staff ensured that I have a great experience. Gihani at reception, Nikita front office management, Lumbinibat restaurant and Dharmapriya as resident manager were among the team who made our stay memorable.
The room was spacious well equipped and satisfy all guest needs. Food served at the restaurant is not only delicious but surely affordable for any. 
I trust it’s needless to mention that I would stay at this lovely hotel only next visit to Kandy.
title: Extraordinary and offer value for your money!

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text: The true gauge of a hotel is its staff and the quality of the service they provide  - the Grand Serendib Hotel  not only ticked all the boxes, but it exceeded all expectations. From the moment you arrive until the time you part ways and check out this hotel delivers in every way. The rooms are quality and comfortable - views of Kandy greet you as soon as you pull back the curtains and it’s hard to not just enjoy the balcony outlook and sit and enjoy the city below. The staff though are simply awesome - smiles all round, caring for their guests like a member of the family!  The food quality was also beyond belief -chefs and table service staff could not be better - a winning team! The meals for dinner and breakfast were just the perfect add on to the pleasure of staying and sharing Kandy. The rating for the hotel is well earned and deserved and any visitor to Kandy should seek out this wonderful escape and the ever smiling staff who make hotel stays that level above the remarkable! Well done to all the crew and the attention you pay to those passing travellers!
title: The only place to stay in Kandy!

text: We were at the Grand Serendib for 3 days. The hotel is brandnew (opened 1 year ago).  The view from the dining area is really spectacular. The staff is very helpful and the food is amazing. (breakfast is a very extended buffet) Only downside was that there was a lot of noise coming from the hallway and other floors in the hotel during the night. But maybe that was because we had the first room after leaving the elevator.

Very nice hotel, not very far from the city center. Nice breakfast and breathtaking outside pool facing the city. 
Highly recommended for a small rest from hectic roadtrip. They have a very nice restaurant and lounge bar with amazing cocktail. 
Only the shower is not physically separated from the rest of the bathroom, so everything gets wet when you shower.
title: Very Nice rest from hectic roadtrip

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text:
I regret to say that our stay at the Grand Serendip Hotel in Kandy was far from the relaxing experience we hoped for. Despite our initial positive impression from their rooftop bar, our stay was marred by a series of disappointments.

We booked a deluxe room with a balcony, but upon arrival, we were informed that the room didn’t have the balcony. The hotel promised us a double upgrade for the final night, but this turned out to be an empty promise. The room we were eventually given was smaller and less appealing than our original room, with a tiny balcony that hardly met our expectations.

The issues didn’t stop there. The voucher we received for the rooftop bar was misleading. We were told we would get a free drink and a 10% discount, but when we tried to use it, the staff claimed that only the 10% discount was valid and refused to honor the free drink. The food and drinks we had were subpar, with poor quality and slow service. We were also not provided an itemized receipt for our bill, which led to confusion and frustration when we were charged inconsistently with what was promised.

The staff, particularly the head concierge Nikitha, were unhelpful and condescending. We were made to feel like an inconvenience rather than valued guests. After numerous attempts to resolve the issues, including an unacceptable bill and rude service, we were eventually offered a partial discount as compensation.

In summary, our stay was plagued with poor service, unfulfilled promises, and a lack of professionalism. I would not recommend the Grand Serendip Hotel based on our experience.
title: Horrific

text: Great hotel with amazing views towards Kandy centre. We could see the temple from the balconies and hear the Perahera happening whilst having dinner. The pool although we regrettably didnt use had outstanding views. Staff is very kind. The room was spacious and very well mantained. If any setback is that the restaurants menu is limited and catered to the international tourist that is afraid of local cuisine (us not being from that category were slightly disappointed). But in general terms it is a great great place to stay. Highly recommend!
title: Great place with outstanding views

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text: Our extended family of 8 stayed for three nights in three rooms in July 2024. The room was lovely and from the window we could see the Kandy Lake and the Dalada Maligawa. The room was well equipped, clean and well serviced. We interacted with the Operations Manager, down to the Porter and Housekeeping staff. They were all friendly and very helpful. We had breakfast and dinner at the Restaurant. There was a wide selection of dishes at the buffet and they were all tasty. Each evening there was a singer to entertain. The two two children in our party loved dancing to the music. One evening we had a friend visiting for dinner. That day was actually her birthday. This was mentioned to one of the restaurant staff and we were surprised to receive a birthday cake and all the staff plus the singer joined in to sign Happy Birthday. A few hours after we checked-out from the hotel, received a call to say that the Housekeeping staff had found a rosary in our room. It was my wife's. They agreed to courier it to a relative of ours. As you can see, we enjoyed our stay, thought the staff and Restaurant was wonderful and would love to visit again.
title: Woderful hotel with friendly and helpful staff

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text:
If you want a stay in Kandy with a beautiful view of the city, lake and surrounding hills you won’t be disappointed here! 
This hotel is clean, bright and the staff are friendly and helpful. The hotel is set high on the hill so the views are really something to write home about!  The open airy restaurant where breakfast is served daily really captures the Kandy skyline but the jewel of the hotel is the infinity pool that also captures the amazing views! Location is great and it’s a pretty easy downhill walk to the lake. You might want grab a tuk tuk to get back as it’s an uphill hike. We loved our stay in Kandy and I would highly recommend this hotel!
title: Beautiful Kandy Views

placeInfo: {'id': '25367549', 'name': 'Grand Serendib Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 190, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.285386, 'longitude': 80.64447, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d25367549-Reviews-Grand_Serendib_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.grandserendibhotel.com', 'address': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '#12 Mahamaya Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 4, 'count2': 6, 'count3': 7, 'count4': 20, 'count5': 154}}
text:
I’ve been traveling through Sri Lanka for the past two weeks, staying in a a new hotel each night. This is BY FAR, the best hotel I’ve stayed at during my trip. Here are my reasons.
1. For the price, you get far more than you pay for. 
2. The hotel is impeccably maintained. The rooms, the restaurants, all are spotless. 
3. The view is outstanding. As I sit here at breakfast sipping my coffee, I am in awe at the beauty of the city of Kandy. 
4. The view gets better as you head to the top floor which is called the Sky Lounge. There is a bar and restaurant serving fantastic drinks along with a variety of hookah offerings. 
5. The restaurant had a wonderful breakfast buffet and the a la cart menu for dinner was fantastic as well. 
6. The rooms. I walked in and immediately felt as I have arrived to luxury.  The bed was the softest I’ve slept in during my time in Sri Lanka. This served for the best night sleep I’ve had in weeks. The sliding glass door lead to the balcony which had a great view. 
7. The pool. This was an infinity pool overlooking the city. What more can you ask for. 
8. Location. I wanted something outside the city with a nice view but also in a quiet area as noise had bothered me at other hotels. The room was perfectly silent. Exactly what I needed before my long trip home. 
9. And last but not least, the hospitality. Lumbini was so sweet. Everyone you encounter is super kind with a smile on their face. Going above and beyond for every request you make. 
I will 100% return next time I’m in Kandy.
title: Best hotel I’ve stayed at in Sri Lanka!

text:
Citadel was our mid point going towards the central hills of Sri Lanka for a survey and a staff trip to the Knuckles. Check in and out was a breeze as the staff were prepared and courteous. Meals were perfect thanks to the Exec Chef Dinesh and Sous chef. Thank you for the pre ordered cake which was tasty and consumed in bulk :) The hotel offers preorder cakes. Bar - ask for the day's special and they do not disappoint. We like to eat inside the restaurant where there's more light, but for a special occasion they go out of the way with table seating and arrangements and extra items for very small costs. 
Special note of gratitude to RM Mr Keerthi Wimalasuriya and FOM Guillame. The place is extraordinary because of you. Thank you.
title: Highlight of our Annual Staff Trip

placeInfo: {'id': '797403', 'name': 'Cinnamon Citadel Kandy', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 4330, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.3058, 'longitude': 80.6236, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d797403-Reviews-Cinnamon_Citadel_Kandy-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.cinnamonhotels.com/cinnamoncitadelkandy', 'address': 'Srimath Kuda Ratwatte Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': 'Srimath Kuda Ratwatte Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 92, 'count2': 117, 'count3': 439, 'count4': 1556, 'count5': 2128}}
text:
Cinnamon Citadel Kandy is nestled in a beautiful riverside location, offering serene views and a tranquil atmosphere. The rooms are spacious and well-maintained, providing a comfortable stay. The staff are generally polite and attentive, ensuring that guests feel welcomed and looked after. The pool area and other amenities contribute to a relaxing experience, making it a good choice for travelers seeking peace and natural beauty.

However, there is room for improvement when it comes to the dining experience, particularly during breakfast. The restaurant staff, while courteous, could improve coordination, especially in managing services like tea and coffee. On busier days, such as when the hotel is fully booked, the team should plan ahead to accommodate the increased number of guests efficiently. Better organization during peak hours would significantly enhance the dining experience.

Overall, Cinnamon Citadel Kandy offers a pleasant stay, but with improved restaurant management, particularly during busy times, it could elevate the experience to the next level.
title: A Scenic Stay

The hotel is very big and very noisy. It is not even close to being as lovely as the photo's imply. 
Our first room was so noisy that we got moved, but the second room was just as noisy, so we cut our trip short. 
The hotel is a long way from town, up and down a very long, steep hill. You can't walk it, so have to tuk-tuk it everywhere. 
I would not stay here again.
title: Don't waste your money

text: Kandy is a city in Sri Lanka known for its rich history and cultural significance. It's also a notable area for coffee cultivation. The coffee grown in Kandy and its surrounding regions is renowned for its distinct flavors, influenced by the region's unique climate and soil. Kandy coffee often has a rich, full-bodied taste with a hint of floral or fruity notes. The city is also famous for the Temple of the Tooth Relic, a significant Buddhist site, and the picturesque Kandy Lake.
title: Kandy is a city in Sri Lanka known for its rich history and cultural significance. It's also a notable area for coffee cultivati

roomTip: Take the boat ride
text:
We stayed in the superior rooms which overlooked the river and had a balcony
Apparently best in the hotel. However the road noise was bad especially if left the bathroom door open.
Buffet for dinner was very good and much better than Cinnamon Habarana Village
Looked and tasted fresher. However let down by breakfast which was mediocre at best.
Boat trip before breakfast was good.
Service okay however could not get through to reception to order a porter for luggage to checkout
 We were on the other side of the hotel to reception with plenty of stairs to negotiate. Thankfully a cleaner ordered one for us.
Overall a pleasant experience
title: Nice location

text: I don't recommend this hotel at all. The room had chips on the floor, broken tiles in the bathroom, the mini bar did not work, and they only gave us a hand towel if we asked for it, if not, none. The worst thing is tomorrow, we have been charged three beers that we had not had, when the waiter brought us the bill, he asked us about our trip and we did not pay attention to the receipt. This morning we have been treated very badly at reception, which was our fault, and when I told him that I wanted to write a complaint, they told me that it could not be. Fortunately we are not going to any hotel of Cinamon in Sri Lanka and I am not going to recommend it in Spain to friends.

roomTip: Definitely take a boat ride up and down the Mighty Mahaweli River and you will be pleasantly surprised at what you will experience!
text: Located on the banks of the Mighty Mahaweli, Cinnamon Citadel is a beautifully maintained and presented Hotel. The staff are attentive, kind and always looking to help and Cinnamon Citadel is in close proximity of everything that the ancient Kingdom of Kandy has to offer.
title: Located on the banks of the Mighty Mahaweli, Cinnamon Citadel is a beautiful place to stay at when visiting Kandy!

text: We had a great stay at the cinnamon citadel with family.  Fantastic location, by the River. The most relaxing hotel in Kandy. The rooms are spacious with lovely views, wonderful boat ride and high tea. Great breakfast selection. Surrounded by nature and lovely pool over looking the greenery
title: Best hotel in Kandy with a view

text: This is my 3rd hotel on a tour around Sri Lanka definitely one of the best so far. Food is lovely and service is excellent. Staff are all so friendly and nothing is too much trouble whatsoever for anyone. Very welcoming and treated so well from start too finish. Shout out to Ruwanthi on reception who was lovely and friendly and went and got the room checked before I left to make sure I hadn't forgotten anything. When I return to Sri Lanka I will definitely be staying here again .
title: Beautiful Hotel

text: The hotel hospitality was wonderful!! The ambience and food were really impressive. The rooms are super comfortable and the aesthetics of the decor were nice, especially the royal family sketches. Special shout out to Ruwanthi, Tharushi, Thathsarani and other staff who were so warm to us and made us feel at home! Only complaint is that the carpeting in the corridors had a musty stink. Otherwise highly recommended!

placeInfo: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
text:
My wife and I stayed in this hotel for 2 nights in October 2024.

1.	Good Points
a.	This hotel is situated well 5-10Min walk to few restaurants, down the road, across the bridge.
b.	The room and toilet were clean.
c.	The staffs were friendly and very accommodating to our requests.
d.	The hotel has a bar near the restaurant. The cocktails served was good. This was my personal favorite.
e.	The buffet breakfast had decent amount of food variety, mostly Indian food of course, and it was all tasty.

2.	Bad Points
a.	I paid USD250 Per Night (including taxes) for the Luxury King room. Sadly, the room came with limited view of the Mountain/town. 
b.	The hotel does have a nice swimming pool, but it’s always crowded 
c.     The pillow and bed was just OK, nothing great

3.	Will I return again to this hotel?
No
title: Nice Hotel But Can Be Better

placeInfo: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
text: The view is nothing less than both stunning and breathtaking. The location is far up in the mountains and does not have a lot of opportunities surrounding it, as we could find. Food delivery or hotel-buffet options are possible still. The pool is quite beautiful nevertheless and you will for sure relax during your stay here. The hotel accommodates a lot of weddings, so prepare to see one- or more while you are staying there.
title: Stunning view

placeInfo: {'id': '5566703', 'name': "Earl's Regent Hotel", 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 1718, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.283507, 'longitude': 80.61064, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d5566703-Reviews-Earl_s_Regent_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'http://www.regentkandy.lk', 'address': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha, Kandy 020400 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '40 / 1, Deveni Rajasinghe Mawatha', 'street2': None, 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '020400'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 54, 'count2': 65, 'count3': 158, 'count4': 502, 'count5': 939}}
text:
We dined at the restaurant during our stay. We visited for dinner and were looked after by our waiter, Anju, who truly went above and beyond in making sure our dining experience was flawless. His attention to detail and timely service really stood out and made us feel well taken care of throughout the meal.

For dinner we ordered the mixed seafood grill which was absolutely delicious. The prawns were succulent and the fish was marinated and grilled well. Will definitely visit again. Highly recommended!
title: Great food and service, worth the price.

ownerResponse:
{'id': '970248581', 'text': 'Thank you for sharing your experience with us! We’re delighted to hear that you had a pleasant two-night stay and enjoyed the exceptional buffet, especially during the wedding celebration. It’s great to know that the variety of dishes catered to different diets, and we’re glad you had a comfortable stay with beautiful mountain views from your balcony.

We apologize for the slight inconvenience with the club sandwich and appreciate your feedback. We’ll certainly review this with our culinary team to ensure all meals meet the high standards you experienced with the buffet.

text:
We had two nights here on our tour. There was a wedding the first night so the food buffet that night was  exceptional. It was still excellent the next night with a huge variety that would cater to any diet but it was clear some dishes like the tandoori chicken and special desserts had been made for the wedding. 
Again we didn’t need a travel adapter as the sockets were three pin as in the Uk .
Our balcony over looked the mountains. Beds were very comfortable and the shower was good. 
There was some noise from the wedding but it was joyful and didn’t end late. Staff were very attentive.
We ordered a club sandwich one lunch time that was bland.
title: Pleasant stay, great buffet food.

text: I recently had my mother’s 80th birthday party at Earls Regent. When hotels in Kandy hesitated to take my booking due to Bradby night, Earls Regent was not only taken my booking, but also they did their best to make my mom’s 80th is memorable one. I didn’t even visit to the place and decide everything virtually and remotely. Special thanks should go to Udari Sethunga who was with us from the beginning till the end and she attended every little request even while having her day off. Thank you Udari and staff in the banquets department.
title: One of the best in Kandy

text:
Nice place.... Friendly staff...  I went with family and stayed coz there was a family wedding which we had to attend at the same hotel.

Charuka was extra helpful... 

The facilities in the hotel are little older. AC controller of the room had a half black screen and difficult to see the figures. The washroom in the pool had many corroded parts. 

But the pool attendant was nice and did all to make my morning swim comfortable..... 

Overall the stay is good.... I liked the location as well...
title: Nice Hotel - good stay

roomTip: Nothing to worry ! Come and enjoy this place. Nothing is bad .
text:
Our two-night stay at this hotel was a positive experience. We wanted to provide a feedback because we believe it could help others in planning their trips.
The hotel staff were exceptional, particularly Chaminda in the dining area, who was attentive and dedicated to providing excellent service to our family. Sasintha, another server, also interacted with us in a commendable manner.

The hotel's location and rooms were impressive, and Darshana at the front office was very helpful. Umesh, who assisted with our booking, demonstrated great attention to detail and ensured our room was upgraded as well. 
Overall, our stay at this hotel was wonderful.

text:
Hotel with a stunning view. We came here for a night out and the view was amazing. It's on a top of hill so the weather is but chilled. You can see a beautiful sunset. Pool is available but the water is bit cold. 
We stayed in premium deluxe room and room was nice with a view. It includes a bathtub also. 
Staff is friendly and Ms Imalka in the buffet area helped us alot. Food is good but can be improved. Overall stay was nice.
title: Hotel with a stunning view

placeInfo: {'id': '480276', 'name': 'Amaya Hills Kandy', 'rating': 4, 'numberOfReviews': 3691, 'locationString': 'Heerassagala, Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.25913, 'longitude': 80.61932, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g12220047-d480276-Reviews-Amaya_Hills_Kandy-Heerassagala_Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://staahmax.staah.net/be/indexpackdetail?display=&groupId=MjA5Ng%3D%3D&display=firm&submit=Search&m_currency=LKR&propertyId=MjA3Nw==&promoCode=AMAYA24&_', 'address': 'Heerassagala, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': None, 'street2': None, 'city': 'Heerassagala', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 97, 'count2': 127, 'count3': 457, 'count4': 1173, 'count5': 1841}}
roomTip: Great if you want to get away and stay in the hotel and hide from the world.
text:
Jaw droppingly beautiful setting, we stayed here as part of a Luxury Escapes tour,  
Positives: getting here at sunset, and stunning views, lovely welcome drink. Great gym and even has a squash court. Gorgeous pool area, bit cold though as in mountains.

Negatives: got the rooms at the back of hotel overlooking road (no privacy really), and rooms smallish and bathrooms very small!  Smelly as well (think it was the toilet water, smelt like a sewer).  Nice decor and clean enough, although only an overhead rainfall type shower and no shower caps, so had to recycle one from earlier. Shower over the bath and very slippery, not safe.

Not located close to Kandy (20 minutes up a windy road), so no options for food except hotel unless you wanted to arrange a tuk tuk, which was annoying. Food in hotel wasn't cheap as they have a captive audience due to location.  Got excited as there is a nightclub on premises, but it's only open on weekends. The other bar was closed for a conference or something, so no atmosphere to speak of.  We ended up drinking with a few others on the large verandah.  Apparently they wanted to charge $20USD for corkage for the others to drink their own wine outside (even though we weren't in the bar or restaurant),

This hotel has great potential, but is sadly let down by a few things. Beautiful lobby. 

I would not stay here again, I would stay in the city and seek some atmostphere.
title: Stunning views (but too far from Kandy)

text:
Every bit of the Amaya hospitality continued! They went one notch up with the magic of their chef! Buffet spread by itself is amazing but Chef Ravindra Munisinghe made it even more special by giving us a traditional Srilankan vegetarian cuisine! The incredible taste of the spices and the taste just blew us away! Hospitality is something that is flawless! The manager Mr Dayal was so attentive and made sure that we were completely taken care of! 

The beginning of our relaxing holiday in Srilanka began here! Turn down service, to fruits and chocolates in the room! It’s amazing! It’s far away from the bustling city and that is what I loved about it! The views from the restaurant and the rooms is stunning! The mountains and clouds and the birds chirping is perfect for a quiet relaxing holiday! Can’t thank Amaya Hills team for the wonderful experience we’ve had!
title: Perfect for mind, body and soul

text:
Amazing service, food and stay.

All staff were very friendly, respecfull and comitted to the service.

Restaurant had vast range of meals with different cuisine that provides guests to try variety of dishes.

Rooms were nice, comfortable with mount view.

Appreciate the service and can't wait for the next booking.

Chaminda and Asiri were kindly explained dishes those were not on buffet and that can be specially ordered. Also Ravindra (one of the Chefs) advised to order anything we specifically require.

Dulakshi at restaurant reception was always with a smile and kind. 

Thank you all.

Sisil Samantha

Room no.s 89 & 90
title: Amazing experince at Amaya Hills

text: Beautiful hotel perched high in the hills above Kandy. My room was spacious and well-appointed, with a balcony overlooking the pool and with great views over the hills and surrounding countryside (the sunsets were superb every night). The facilities, including the restaurant (the buffet breakfast was fab), large pool, gym and spa (where I had an excellent facial), are very good and the staff extremely accommodating, helping me to organise transportation and activities. The hotel was a peaceful place to return to after spending my days exploring the bustling Kandy city.
title: Beautiful hotel in the hills above Kandy

text:
Had just a one night stay here for a birthday dinner for my husband.
Lovely room overlooking the lily pond, very well appointed.
Dinner was buffet style with plenty of choices and attentive staff, food prepared at various stations along the buffet. Excellent  "hopper".
A delicious birthday cake arrived presented by the staff, much appreciated. 
Lovely pool area, would gladly stay in this hotel on future visits.

placeInfo: {'id': '316941', 'name': 'Mahaweli Reach Hotel', 'rating': 4.5, 'numberOfReviews': 2584, 'locationString': 'Kandy, Kandy District, Central Province', 'latitude': 7.325309, 'longitude': 80.63124, 'webUrl': 'https://www.tripadvisor.com/Hotel_Review-g304138-d316941-Reviews-Mahaweli_Reach_Hotel-Kandy_Kandy_District_Central_Province.html', 'website': 'https://www.mahaweli.com/', 'address': '35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha, Kandy 20000 Sri Lanka', 'addressObj': {'street1': '35 PBA Weerakoon Mawatha', 'street2': '', 'city': 'Kandy', 'state': None, 'country': 'Sri Lanka', 'postalcode': '20000'}, 'ratingHistogram': {'count1': 99, 'count2': 92, 'count3': 274, 'count4': 591, 'count5': 1528}}
text:
The Mahaweli Reach Hotel was my accommodation in Kandy. Having reached it after a long day, I instantly fell in love with it. The building was a beautiful, immaculate white with the façade reminding me of colonial buildings.

Upon entering, I was greeted by the front desk on my left, a garden in front of me, and a restaurant on my right. The front desk staff made me sit comfortably in the reception area while they smoothly carried out my check in formalities.

I was then taken to my room for which I had to cross the shopping arcade and the swimming pool. The shopping arcade looked quite glitzy and had a gemstone shop from where I was almost tempted to buy a few gems/ gem – encrusted jewellery.

The swimming pool, located on the ground floor, looked ethereal, illuminated by soft lanterns placed all around it. Dip into it! It was surrounded by the garden, the Uyana Restaurant, the Tamarind Bar, the deck area and a set of rooms, making it the central feature of the hotel.

I had booked myself a Deluxe Room that overlooked the River Mahaweli Ganga, a fact I realised the next morning! A lovely bookmark, with a quote from Buddha and a Nasturtium flower tucked into it, welcomed me into my room.

The room was of an adequate size, comfortably furnished, with all amenities available, as can be expected from a good hotel. The room was quite comfortable from a sleep POV; I got two good nights of sleep here.

The bathroom turned out to be quite a different one. The bathing area was at an elevation, and one had to climb a few steps, open a glass door and step inside for a shower.
I have to admit that it was not a great design from a safety viewpoint.

Most of my meals were at the Uyana Restaurant. Indulging in its dinner buffet was one of the top highlights during my stay. You should not miss the breakfast buffet either.
The restaurant offers a delightful array of freshly – baked pastries, a variety of fruits, and a selection of hot and cold dishes to kickstart your day.

I had a drink at the Tamarind Bar too. Sprawled on an armchair, I sipped on a Mango Martini made expertly by the smiling bartender. Enjoy your cocktails while partying with friends.

And that brings me to the staff attitude. I absolutely LOVED the staff at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel. All of them were always attentive, ever efficient and tremendously cordial. Every single one of them!
I was made to feel like a cherished guest and also made comfortable as I was a solo woman traveller.

I did not use many services at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel as I was mostly out and about sightseeing, but I did avail myself of the boat cruise offering.

To summarise, Mahaweli Reach Hotel in Kandy is indeed a good hotel, known for its exceptional service and luxurious amenities. It stands out as a premier establishment.

The breathtaking view of River Mahaweli Ganga creates a stunning backdrop as you unwind and socialise in this vibrant setting. As Mahaweli Reach Hotel is located a little away from the attractions of Kandy, it serves as an ideal resting place.
title: Book a stay with them!

text:
We were a large group staying at this great hotel. We were in Kandy for a school reunion and attended several well executed functions at this hotel. 

However, what makes a great hotel, extraordinary are their staff. This is where this hotel truly shines  across all departments- Front Office, Bell boys, Restaurant staff and chefs and Housekeeping. A special mention must be made of Kavisha. She was exceptionally helpful with her cheerful and winning ways. It is evident that this hotel invests in their staff and training takes pride of place. 

The breakfast buffet was mind boggling. One did not know where to start- the choices available were truly huge. No one could possibly leave unsatisfied. The chefs did a great job displaying their skills and craft.

I strongly recommend this hotel if you want a comfortable and memorable stay in Kandy.
title: Great hotel elevated to extraordinary thanks to well trained staff

text: We were unfortunate guests in the hotel where the commode was overflowing and the wardrobe door got jammed. Spoke with the owner Asitha Panabokke and  got it fixed after 2 hours. text:
Room was not ready!!! 
After traveling from Colombo to Kandy to spend a quiet weekend. We arrived at 2pm for the checking, until 4:18pm we didn’t get the room. Had to wait 2hrs and 18minute to check in 😩 please improve the checking process.

The room is in excellent condition. Well maintained. Very clean. I am happy with what we got.

Food is very yum. Fresh and tasty.

The staff are very kind and friendly. 

The atmosphere is very calm, an excellent place to relax and chill. Specially the river that flows next to the hotel gives and amazing view.
title: Checking was a nightmare but after that it was great

text:
Our second visit to Mahaweli Reach was undoubtedly a good choice. We were warmly welcomed by Sarath, whom we met in 2019. The friendly and polite staff, all with big smiles, added charm to the hotel.
 
The hotel, garden, and rooms were clean and tidy. The dinner and breakfast buffets offered a wide variety of local and international dishes. Indika and Anjana, two amazing staff members, stood out. Anjana was very friendly and professional, ensuring our table for 10 was always ready. Indika went out of his way to assist us when one of our kids was sick and throughout our stay, exceeding our expectations.
 
Special thanks to the front office staff for arranging a vehicle and to Sarath for accompanying us to the hospital free of charge. Sarath's exceptional service made a big difference.
 
To improve, replacing the old and discolored grout around the bathroom sink and bathtub would enhance the bathroom's presentation, which I've mentioned to the public area supervisor.
 
We will definitely return on our next visit to Sri Lanka.
title: Recent Stay

text:
We visited the Mahaweli Reach Hotel on July 6th for the morning buffet. Although we arrived a bit late, the reception staff were initially reluctant to let us join. However, Ms. Nadeesah, the  stewardess , kindly encouraged us to enjoy the buffet and assured us that she would bring some food items to our table to save time. . She fulfilled her promise, allowing us to finish our meal in just 40 minutes. If we had followed the initial advice from the reception, we might not have had the opportunity to  have th breakfast  at your hotel and would have left looking for another hotel in Kandy. 
Ms. Nadeesah's exceptional business acumen was instrumental in our decision to stay back for the buffet. Your esteemed hotel, like many others in Sri Lanka, would greatly benefit from more staff members like  Nadeesha the stewardess , who use their common sense to attract guests. We also observed her assisting other foreign guests who arrived late, ensuring they could enjoy the morning buffet as well.

As Sri Lanka strives to promote tourism and boost foreign revenue, it is essential to encourage and support dedicated individuals like Ms. Nadeesah. We wish her all a all the luck !!
We aslos wish to  mention  that the food was quite good and the Hopper makers were helpful. However  as we had overstayted for 5 minutes one steward  informed us that time is up signalling us to leave.  I wish that this gentleman could have used a much more polite tone !!
Overall the expreince at your hotel was satisfatoty !! Damayanthie Rajapakse
title: Buisness acumen of Ms Nadeesha ( stewardess ) at your hotel

text: Trust me this hotel is so dam good better than any other 5 star property in Kandy. Magnificent rooms, elegant bathrooms. Balconies facing the Kandy river is so serene. Special mention to the restaurant supervisor Anjana who was very helpful and the bar attender Asinka who always treated you with a smile. Kudos to the entire team. Only one glitch the restaurant area has flies during rainy season.
title: The most beautiful 5 star property in Kandy

text: I've had the opportunity to stay at the Mahaweli Reach Hotel every year for the last 15 years-- it feels like a home away from home. The staff-- especially Nadeesha, who staffs the restaurant-- are attentive and thoughtful. The hotel itself, which has been a fixture in Kandy for decades, is quiet, peaceful, and perfectly situated by the banks of the Mahaweli river. A perfect base for exploring the hill country!
title: A Great Historic Hotel in Kandy

text:
First impressions - although located in a beautiful place, our welcome was subpar as we felt a bit neglected by the reception. All attention was on the foreigners who had arrived in a bus. We had to remind them that we arrived too.

The rooms were superb. Massive and spacious. Kids thoroughly enjoyed.

We stayed 2 nights and both breakfasts were great. Nadeesha served us on day 2. She was very friendly and lovely. Only negative was that she interrupted our breakfast and wanted me to post a review and include her name. 

Food was good.

Pool is huge and spectacular.

We enjoyed our stay! Could improve on staff training.
title: 2 night stay as a local family
